Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • Camera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GlobalHelper

    public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
implements GlobalHelper

    Camera

    Used for following the player around the World

    This is a simple class which keeps track of the player as they move around the map, making sure the viewport is centered on them. It provides important "translations" between the frequently confusing pixel and tile values that the TiledMap class likes to use in its render() method.
    Since:
    2015-09-11
    Author:
    Daniel Porteous porteousd

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      This constructor receives a lot of arguments, which it then stores, but this is preferable to having to pass them every single time update is called since they're all constants.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getMapX()
      Standard getter that returns mapX, the global position of the camera on the horizontal plane.

      Standard getter that returns mapY, the global position of the camera on the vertical plane.
      int getSX()
      Standard getter that returns sx, the horizontal tile at which to start rendering.
      int getSY()
      Standard getter that returns sy, the vertical tile at which to start rendering.

      Standard getter that returns x (this is relative to the screen).
      double getY()
      Standard getter that returns y (this is relative to the screen).
      void update(double x, double y)
      Takes in the current global/map wide position of the kart and resolves this into the x and y coordinates of the screen and the tile position from which to start rendering.

        public static final int SCREEN_OFFSET

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera(double startX,
              double startY,
              int screenWidth,
              int screenHeight,
              int numTilesWide,
              int numTilesHigh)
        This constructor receives a lot of arguments, which it then stores, but this is preferable to having to pass them every single time update is called since they're all constants.
        Parameters:
        startX - The starting x-coordinate of the Camera. This will likely be that of the Player.
        startY - The starting y-coordinate of the Camera. This will likely be that of the Player.
        screenWidth - Screen width in pixels.
        screenHeight - Screen height in pixels.
        numTilesWide - Number of tiles wide to be rendered.
        numTilesHigh - Number of tiles high to be rendered.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(double x,
                   double y)
        Takes in the current global/map wide position of the kart and resolves this into the x and y coordinates of the screen and the tile position from which to start rendering.
        Parameters:
        x - In pixels. The position of the target on the horizontal plane.
        y - In pixels. The position of the target on the vertical plane.
